td.p: Thomson, John. Journal, Mackenzie River, 1800-1802. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0021

div.p: to the plan recomended by the Blind Chief – it is apparently a pretty good one there being a sufficiency of wood &c – a full view of the Rocky Mountain on the opposite side which does not appear to be above half a league from the water side[.] The Men Delivered their Baggages[,] made our Encampment &c – which done gave them a Dram[.] The young Man tells us that one of his Countrymen put an orignal en cache, not far off which he thinks to be able to find.

Tuesday the 14th[.] Early this morning gave the Men 4 large Axes, & a file in order to set about Building as quick as possible[.] Sent 3 Men in a large Canoe with the young Man in search of the orignal that is en cache[.] Sent away La Violette & St André with the Little Chiefs Brother in law in quest of the Big Chief & other Indians, gave La Violette 3 Meas Amunition[,] a fire stick & 1½ foot tobc & 1½ foot Tobaco to St André & each a Dram, Sent to the Big Chief ¾ of a fathom Tobacco[.] The Indian that we embarked at the Forks went back again, gave him 40 Skins on Credit[.] The Little Chiefs young Son & youngest Brother in law (2 Boys) came to pay me a vissit[,] gave them a Dram & ps of Tobc – the former traded 2 Beavertails[.] The Men raised the half of the Entourage of the Hangard[,] its size is 24 by 20 feet.

Wednesday the 15th[.] In the forenoon the 3 Men came back after having made a useless voyage, for the y Man could not find the orignal – he traded 2 cascamisks. [S]ent him off along with St Cir in quest of the Indians that are on the other side – sent by him for them 2 foot of Tobacco[,] gave St Cir 1½ foot tobacco[,] 1 fire stick & a Dram & about 15lbs Pemican[.] N.B. gave La Violette yesterday about 20lbs Ditto & a little pounded Meat & Grease[.] Finished the Entourage of the hangard & put up about Two thirds of the Covering[.] Snowed a little[.]
